Patterns

  • User login

Dialogue boxes

Use dialogue boxes to convey important information to the user.

  1. Error dialogue
  2. Information dialogue
  3. Success dialogue
  4. Warning dialogue

1. Error dialogue

Use the error dialogue to highlight problems to the user. This might be a problem with information they have provided or a problem with our systems that is preventing them from doing something.

There's a problem

It looks like there might be a problem with our system. Please try again in a few minutes. We’re sorry for the inconvenience.
HTML injected here
Angular example usage:

2. Information dialogue

Use the information dialogue to highlight important information to the user that might impact on what it is they’re trying to do.

Important information

Our site will be down for maintenance between 20:00 and 22:00 on 1 June 2019. You won’t be able to access the site during this time. We’re sorry for any inconvenience this might cause.
HTML injected here
Angular example usage:

3. Success dialogue

Use the success dialogue to confirm to the user that an action has successfully taken place.

Your details have been saved

Thanks for updating your contact details. Our system has now been updated.
HTML injected here
Angular example usage:

4. Warning dialogue

Use the warning dialogue to warn users if they’re about to do something that is destructive or when the result of an action is unexpected.

Check your application before submitting

Once you’ve submitted the details of your application you won’t be able to go back and change anything. Take a moment to double check everything is correct before submitting.
HTML injected here
Angular example usage:
